title: Non-exit on Failed Initialization
overview: The software does not exit or otherwise modify its operation when security-relevant errors occur during initialization, such as when a configuration file has a format error, which can cause the software to execute in a less secure fashion than intended by the administrator.
remediation: ::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Follow the principle of failing securely when an error occurs. The system should enter a state where it is not vulnerable and will not display sensitive error messages to a potential attacker.::
